ceterms:description:
Curriculum progression will be mapped out in sequence within each major content area (safety, quality, etc.). Students will need to document/demonstrate competence in sequential order within each content area. Various “checkpoints” will be built into the curriculum sequence as a method of ensuring students do not get behind in moving through the program. 
Curriculum Layout & Course Crosswalk
•	Workplace Principles - WPP2001 (1 cr)
•	Safety - ISX1001 (1 cr)
•	Applied Mathematics – MAT110 (3 cr)
•	Hand & Power Tools (including Mechanical Principles & Linkages) – IET1206 (1cr)
•	Metrology & Control Charts – CMM118 (2 cr)
•	Lean Manufacturing – MFG175 (2 cr)
•	Introduction to Quality Management Systems QMS101 (3 cr)
•	Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt – QMS299 (1 cr)

ceterms:estimatedCost.ceterms:description:
Total course $2300
No additional textbook cost
$195 Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt Certification Exam (optional)
Some employers offer scholarships or tuition reimbursement
